channel.title: [Java] Number of Items in an Array List
channel.description:
I'm wondering it this is possible, I need a way to check if there is a number of items in an array list. So if in the game you come to the contract screen it can check how many ores for the contract are in your inventory. If your contract told you to mine 2 Diamond, I want to check to see if there are 2 Diamonds in the players inventory. Sorry if I confused you...
I have looked through this: [url=http://download.oracle.com/javase/1.4.2/docs/api/java/util/ArrayList.html]http://download.oracle.com/javase/1.4.2/docs/api/java/util/ArrayList.html[/url] and can't find a method for it, so I'm just wondering if there would be a way to do this.

item.title: [Java] Number of Items in an Array List
item.dc:creator: @ranger_squad ranger squad
item.description:
@ranger_squad wrote:

[quote=“ollie123, post:2, topic:383555”] int diamonds = 0; for (Item i : inventory) { if(i instanceof Diamond) diamonds++; }

Probably [size=50pt]over 9000[/size] better ways to do this, but perhaps this will do.[/quote]

Sorry, I had to.

Read full topic
item.source: [Java] Number of Items in an Array List

item.title: [Java] Number of Items in an Array List
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

[quote=“sp11k3t3ht3rd, post:3, topic:383555”]The array list contains strings sooo…

[code]int numberOfDiamonds = 0;

for (String str : Player.inventory) {

 if (str == "Diamond") {

      numberOfDiamonds++;

 }

}[/code][/quote]

That’s correct.

Also it’s better to use the equals method for strings instead of the == operator beaten by a newfag

Read full topic
item.source: [Java] Number of Items in an Array List

item.title: [Java] Number of Items in an Array List
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

int diamonds = 0; for (Item i : inventory) { if(i instanceof Diamond) diamonds++; }

Probably over 9000 better ways to do this, but perhaps this will do.
